title: How to Bold the Text on an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone's settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's settings. Do so by tapping the grey gear icon on one of your Home screens (it might also be in a folder named "Utilities").

steps.title: Slide the Bold Text button right to the "On" position.
steps.content: Slide the Bold Text button right to the "On" position. This is in the second group of options.

steps.title: Tap Continue.
steps.content: Tap Continue . Your phone will briefly restart. When it reboots, all of your phone's menu and display text should be bold.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Notes app.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Notes app. Do so by tapping the notepad icon on one of your Home screens (it might also be in a folder named "Productivity" or "Utilities").

steps.title: Tap the "New Note" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "New Note" icon. This is the pencil-and-pad icon in the bottom right corner of your Notes screen. If you have 3-D touch enabled, tap and hold the Notes icon and then select New Note .

steps.title: Tap Select All.
steps.content: Tap Select All . If you only want to bold one word, just tap Select .

steps.title: Tap BIU.
steps.content: Tap BIU . This will be formatted to show bolding, italics, and underlining.

steps.title: Tap Bold.
steps.content: Tap Bold . Your selected text should turn bold as a result.
